isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 9200, 9300 AND 9400 SERIES - CLUTCH PEDAL COMPONENTS

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 2 for the following Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Open the vehicle hood. Pull the cotter pin from the upper clevis pin (Item 2, Figure 2); remove the clevis pin to disconnect the control rod from the pedal shaft lever.
Mark the pedal shaft lever (Item 3) and clutch pedal shaft (Item 8) to assure correct alignment during assembly.
Remove clamp bolt (Item 4) from lever, then remove lever (Item 3) and spacer (Item 5) from the pedal shaft (Item 8).
Remove the sound insulator panel from under the instrument panel.
Remove pedal return spring (Item 11), then mark the pedal (Item 13) and pedal shaft (Item 8) to ensure correct assembly.
Remove the pedal clamp bolt, washer and nut (Item 14), then remove the pedal from the shaft.

Remove the bolts and lockwashers (Item 7) and the bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Item 15) holding the bearings and spring washers (Item 6) onto the steering column bracket and the dash panel. Pull the pedal shaft (Item 8) out, removing bearings and spring washers.
Inspect the pedal stop (Item 9), bearings and shaft. Replace any components that are worn or damaged. Inspect the pedal return spring, and replace if it is stretched, worn or damaged.

Place the shaft, bearings and spring washers in position on steering column bracket and on the dash panel, and start the bolts, washers and locknuts (Items 7 and 15) that retain and support them. Tighten to 18 to 22 ft-lbs. (24 to 30 N•m).

Position the pedal on the end of the pedal shaft, using the aligning marks to position it correctly. Then install the pedal clamp bolt (Item 14), and tighten it to 18 to 22 ft-lbs. (24 to 30 N•m). Install the clutch pedal return spring.
Position the spacer and pedal shaft lever on the pedal shaft, using the aligning marks to ensure correct positioning.

Slide the pedal shaft lever onto the shaft until the end play is removed. The shaft must operate freely. Install the lever clamp bolt, washer and nut (Item 4), and tighten to 18 to 22 ft-lbs. (24 to 30 N•m).
Reconnect the clutch control rod and install the pin and cotter pin removed in REMOVE, Step 1.
Check the clutch internal adjustments; refer to GROUP 11 - CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Check external linkage adjustments; re-adjust as needed. Refer to ADJUSTMENTS
.
Install the sound insulation panel under the instrument panel. Close the hood.
